entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 12 at 8:21PM AKST until November 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 7:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICE JAMS WILL CONTINUE IN THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MAT-SU VALLEY INTO THE WEEKEND... Recent abnormally cold temperatures have caused ice formation on area rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat-Su valleys. This ice formation is causing ice jams, and has led to localized overflow flooding in the vicinity of the jam. Warming weather into
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 12 at 9:07PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to slowly rise through Minor Flood Stage and reach Moderate Flood Stage Sunday as observed rainfall from Nicole reaches the basin. Residents and interests along the river should be prepared for moderate flood impacts to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts. For the St. Johns River...including DeLand...Moderate flooding is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 12 at 9:03PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney will slowly increase to 9.3 feet by early next week as observed rainfall from Nicole reaches the basin. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see moderate flooding impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 12 at 9:01PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The river level at Astor is forecast to decline slightly through Sunday, then hold steady around 4.1 feet through next week as northerly and northeasterly winds opposing flow of the river return. Residents will see Major Flood impacts continuing into next week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 2:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER FOR PORTIONS OF NM SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY... A strong weather system will move across northern and central NM Sunday night and Monday with much colder temperatures, stronger winds, areas of snow, blowing snow, and potential winter travel impacts. There is still some uncertainty with regard to snowfall intensity and location of greatest impacts. However, this system
